faqs.question: Hoeveel kost dit eigendom?
faqs.answer: €308,900 for the complete 3-bedroom, 2-bathroom bungalow. This represents exceptional value at €3,551/m², positioned 40% below comparable Spanish island properties. Payment options can include cash purchases, Spanish mortgages for foreign buyers (available at 70-80% LTV), or staged payments during construction/renovation.

faqs.question: Kunnen buitenlanders eigendom kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Foreign nationals have identical property purchase rights to Spanish citizens, with no restrictions on ownership percentages or property types. The process requires a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), a Spanish bank account for transactions, and typically a lawyer to manage the paperwork. British, EU, and other foreign buyers commonly purchase properties in San Fulgencio with no complications.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten om eigendom te kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price (€308,900), expect 6-8% additional costs covering: transfer tax (3% regional rate), notary fees (0.5-1%), lawyer fees (0.5-1%), and property registry. Annual ownership costs include property tax (IBI, typically €200-400 annually), community fees if applicable, and utilities. These costs are significantly lower than UK equivalents, with no stamp duty or complicated conveyancing.

faqs.question: Kan ik als buitenlander een hypotheek krijgen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign buyers regularly obtain Spanish mortgages covering 70-80% of property value. Most Spanish banks offer competitive rates (currently 2.5-4% fixed) to foreign buyers with proof of income. You'll need an NIE tax number, bank statements, and income verification. Many British buyers successfully mortgage properties in San Fulgencio through Spanish banks or specialist international lenders.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten van levensonderhoud aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca living costs are 30-40% lower than UK equivalents. Groceries, fresh produce, and dining out cost significantly less. Utilities average €80-120 monthly for a small bungalow. Healthcare is affordable (private consultations €50-100 compared to UK private costs). Petrol and car maintenance are cheaper. For a couple, comfortable living on €1,200-1,500 monthly is achievable, with retirees comfortably living on pension income.

faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca een goede plek om eigendom te kopen?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca represents one of Spain's strongest property investment areas. The region combines steady capital appreciation (8% year-on-year locally), proven rental demand from millions of annual tourists, low entry prices compared to other Mediterranean destinations, and lifestyle appeal for both holiday and retirement living. San Fulgencio specifically offers exceptional value with growing infrastructure investment and strong expat community support.

faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca geschikt voor gepensioneerden?
faqs.answer: Excellent for retirees. The region offers affordable living, excellent healthcare with English-speaking doctors, established expat communities, Mediterranean climate, and recreational activities (golf, beaches, hiking). Many British retirees find their pensions stretch further here while maintaining or improving quality of life. Healthcare is accessible and reasonably priced, and the social infrastructure around expat communities eliminates isolation.

faqs.question: Hoe is het weer aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with 300+ days of sunshine annually, average temperatures 17°C in winter (December-February) and 28°C in summer (June-August). Rainfall is minimal, concentrated in autumn and spring. Winters are mild compared to northern Europe—rarely dropping below 5°C—making it ideal for escaping harsh winters while avoiding extreme summer heat of inland Spain. Perfect for outdoor living most of the year.

faqs.question: Hoe ver is de Costa Blanca van België?
faqs.answer: Alicante Airport is approximately 28 minutes from San Fulgencio, with direct flights to UK cities (London, Manchester, Birmingham, Edinburgh) taking 2-2.5 hours. Budget airlines offer frequent cheap flights (often £30-80 each way), making weekend visits home or family visits to your holiday home very affordable. Many property owners make monthly UK trips or host family visits regularly using low-cost carriers.
